page.title: 01Fenlands with its villages
page.content: Situated in Lincolnshire Fen County the area is mainly arable land with some permanent pasture.Main crops are cereals, potatoes and sugar beat with a few alternative crops of peas and beans and patches of kale grown for the phesants. Cattle on permanent pastures are either crossbreeds for meat or LincolnRed Pedigree herds such as that raised by C L Bembridge in Timberland. Founded in 1905 by his father, Mr Bembridge now has 295 animals. He exhibits some animals,with a great deal of success,at the Annual summer agriculturaa shows. A maority of inhabbitants rely for employment on the agriculture so that village life folows the agricutural seasons including game bird shooting. The thriving villages of Martin and Timberlnd, hamlet of Thorpe Tilnney
